# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers Channel

## 1. Summary:
The discussion primarily focused on character locomotion improvements in Hyperfy. Ashxn proposed changing the directional movement to be locked forward (strafe-based), similar to Fortnite/UE, with benefits for VR, first-person view, and tool handling. The team implemented and tested this new locomotion system in the play world, allowing players to maintain camera direction while moving. They also added first-person capability and discussed UI improvements for mobile, particularly making the top-left buttons less intrusive. Other technical topics included skybox rotation implementation, fog effects, and mist behavior issues in "the Grid" environment. The conversation demonstrated rapid iteration with immediate implementation and testing of the locomotion changes, showing Hyperfy's agile development approach.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Is there a way to import assets from another platform's HTML into Hyperfy? (asked by samgittis.eth) A: Unanswered
Q: Could the directional movement be a design option of the world? (asked by PabloFM | Numinia) A: Unanswered
Q: Could there be a speed setting for skybox rotation? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: hiroP | Helpee: Ashxn | Context: Explaining UE's blendspace animation system for character movement | Resolution: Shared a resource link to help understand animation blending for the new locomotion system
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Ashxn | Context: Identifying issue with "the Grid" mist behavior | Resolution: Discovered that setting a color fixes the disappearing mist issue
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: Ashxn | Context: Sharing code for sky rotation with sun direction updates | Resolution: Provided working code snippet that Ashxn confirmed was helpful

## 4. Action Items:
Type: Technical | Description: Implement strafe-based locomotion system with camera-locked forward direction | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Type: Technical | Description: Solve diagonal movement animations for the new locomotion system | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Type: Technical | Description: Fix the mist behavior issue in "the Grid" environment | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom
Type: Technical | Description: Make top-left buttons less intrusive, especially on mobile | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Type: Technical | Description: Fix the #developers channel not updating | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Type: Feature | Description: Add first-person view capability | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Type: Feature | Description: Consider speed settings for skybox rotation | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom
Type: Feature | Description: Implement mobile-specific UI optimizations | Mentioned By: .hyp shaman

# Discord Chat Analysis for "âš¡â”‚general"

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around users testing Hyperfy on different devices and discussing avatar compatibility. BallisticBanana reported issues opening Hyperfy on their iPhone 14 Pro, while Ashxn noted it works fine on an older iPhone 12 Pro, suggesting it might be a device-specific or settings issue rather than an age/budget constraint. Fibelius shared experiences testing older avatar files in Hyperfy, particularly mentioning CloneX VRM files, RTFKT Clone converter tools, and comparing VOIDS and VOYAGERS avatars. They noted that VOYAGERS looked better due to better optimization. Fibelius also mentioned returning to these tools after 2+ years, having previously received CloneX file sets from ZaidKirdsey to learn avatar creation before switching to mushroom farming. The chat also included brief mentions of scam warnings and requests for community support on social media posts.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Why doesn't Hyperfy open on my iPhone 14 Pro? (asked by BallisticBanana) A: It might be a memory issue, though it's surprising for a newer phone. It runs fine on iPhone 12 Pro, so it could be a settings issue. Apple doesn't provide detailed error information for debugging. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: How do older avatar files perform in Hyperfy? (asked by Fibelius) A: VOYAGERS look better than basic VRM files because they were more optimized. (answered by .hyp shaman)
Q: Pls help with CA (asked by Lambheart) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: BallisticBanana | Context: Hyperfy not opening on iPhone 14 Pro | Resolution: Suggested it might be a memory or settings issue, recommended trying different browsers
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: Fibelius | Context: Why VOYAGERS avatars look better than other models | Resolution: Explained that VOYAGERS were more optimized than other avatar models
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: All users | Context: Warning about increased scam attempts | Resolution: Advised "ALWAYS READ BEFORE CLICKING ON SHIT" to avoid scams

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Investigate compatibility issues with Hyperfy on newer iPhones | Description: Debug why Hyperfy fails on iPhone 14 Pro but works on older models | Mentioned By: BallisticBanana
Technical: Improve error reporting for iOS devices | Description: Apple doesn't provide detailed error information, making debugging difficult | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Documentation: Create guidelines for avatar optimization | Description: Different avatar models perform differently based on optimization level | Mentioned By: Fibelius

# Discord Chat Analysis for "ðŸª™â”‚hyper" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment shows minimal substantive technical discussion. The primary topics include:
- Brief mentions of website changes from hyperfy.io to hyperfy.xyz
- A note that the new website contains more relevant information including a litepaper
- Discussion about the outdated nature of v1 (referred to as "legacy")
- Questions about exchange listings and token price movements
- Comments about trading volume and price reporting issues on Dexscreener
- Some negative sentiment expressed about the community atmosphere

The conversation lacks detailed technical discussions, problem-solving, or concrete implementations. Most exchanges are brief and some contain dismissive or negative comments toward other users.

## 2. FAQ
Q: We need a website like hyperfy.io, boss (asked by Xukonth) A: pretty sure its wip, url is hyperfy.xyz (answered by .hyp shaman)
Q: I really want to know if HYPER has been listed on any exchanges, and whether it is affected by the price movements of BTC and ETH. (asked by haihui) A: Only affected really if they become a liquidity suck. Sol doesn't even really move the price much (answered by general hyper)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: Xukonth | Context: Xukonth asking about the website | Resolution: .hyp shaman explained that hyperfy.xyz is the new website with more relevant information including a litepaper

## 4. Action Items
Documentation: Update community resources to clarify that v1 is outdated and should be considered legacy | Mentioned By: .hyp shaman
Technical: Fix Dexscreener price reporting issues | Mentioned By: Xukonth

This is an extremely brief chat segment with minimal technical discussion. MetaMike shared a link to a Twitter/X post, followed by .hyp shaman asking about the .webp format and making a comment about TGA files being "chunk af" (likely meaning large in file size). The conversation appears to be about image file formats for 3D design, but lacks substantive technical content or problem-solving. The final message from .hyp shaman is simply "damn" without context.
